summary: This document is an electronic communication from the FBI's Miami Division requesting assistance from the Document Conversion Laboratory for scanning and automation of telephone records related to an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez, who was the former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein. The document outlines the procedures for handling and processing the records, which are believed to contain information about potential underage victims associated with Epstein.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Rodriguez is the subject of an obstruction of justice case for attempting to sell an address book containing names and numbers of potential underage victims of Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the subject of a child prostitution case, and his name is associated with the address book that Rodriguez attempted to sell.

connections.description: Rodriguez was employed as the house manager and butler for Epstein.

events.title: Obstruction of Justice Case Opened
events.description: The Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez was the former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein.
Rodriguez attempted to sell an address book containing names and numbers of potential underage victims instead of turning it over to law enforcement.
The document outlines procedures for scanning and processing telephone records related to the case.
The telephone records are believed to belong to Epstein and his associates or potential underage victims.
The Miami Division is coordinating with the Document Conversion Laboratory for assistance in handling the records.
